org.opentrafficsim.core.value.vfloat.scalar

Class FloatScalar<U extends Unit<U>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • org.opentrafficsim.core.value.Scalar<U>
        • org.opentrafficsim.core.value.vfloat.scalar.FloatScalar<U>
  • Type Parameters:
    U - the unit of the values in the constructor and for display
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Value<U>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FloatScalar.Abs, FloatScalar.Rel, MutableFloatScalar

    public abstract class FloatScalar<U extends Unit<U>>
extends Scalar<U>
    All calculations are according to IEEE 754. This means that division by zero results in Float.INFINITY, and some calculations could result in NaN. No changes have been made to avoid this, as it is the standard behavior of Java for floating point numbers.

    Copyright (c) 2014 Delft University of Technology, PO Box 5, 2600 AA, Delft, the Netherlands. All rights reserved.
    BSD-style license. See OpenTrafficSim License.

    Version:
    Jun 13, 2014
    Author:
    Alexander Verbraeck, Peter Knoppers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • mutable

        public abstract MutableFloatScalar<U> mutable()
        Create a mutable version of this FloatScalar.
        The mutable version is created as a deep copy of this. Delayed copying is not worthwhile for a Scalar.
        Returns:
        MutableFloatScalar; mutable version of this FloatScalar

      • initialize

        protected final void initialize(float value)
        Initialize the valueSI field (performing conversion to the SI standard unit if needed).
        Parameters:
        value - float; the value in the unit of this FloatScalar

      • initialize

        protected final void initialize(FloatScalar<U> value)
        Initialize the valueSI field. As the provided value is already in the SI standard unit, conversion is never necessary.
        Parameters:
        value - FloatScalar; the value to use for initialization
